Historian Erin Greenwald curated an exhibit at the Historic New Orleans Collection called Purchased Lives about the domestic slave trade.
Greenwald says other southern cities confined the slave trade to a single building or street.
Not New Orleans.
New Orleans was completely saturated.

They were sold on boats, in French Quarter courtyards and in the most sumptuous room of the most luxurious hotel in the South: the St. Louis Hotel.
